snippet: As Greece draws close to running out of money and defaulting on its debt, eurozone finance ministers are scheduled to discuss the matter in Brussels on Monday.
abstract: Finance ministers from eurozone countries prepare to meet with their Greek counterparts in Brussels to help end standoff between country and its international creditors, including International Monetary, over repayment; analysts say prospects for deal seem unlikely.
lead_paragraph: As Greece draws close to running out of money and defaulting on its debt, eurozone finance ministers are scheduled to discuss the matter in Brussels on Monday.

headline.main: Eurozone Ministers to Meet Again on Greek Debt
headline.print_headline: Clock Ticking as Leaders Resume Greece Talks
